intro: Dimorphanthera dekockii var. chlorocarpa, commonly known as the chlorocarpic dimorphanthera, is a rare and endemic plant species native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that display a unique coloration pattern. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun conditions. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in a fine, silky pubescence. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
